title: Install Patch over Base+Previous Version, Logged in
custom_preconds:
- Base build is installed and current store version is patched over base
- User is logged in to an MLB.tv Premium Entitled Account in previous build.
custom_steps:
1. Install In-Test MLB.tv build
2. Launch installed build
3. Navigate to Menu>Settings
custom_expected: Next to "Logged in as" field app shows same MLB.tv Premium Entitled Account as the account user was logged in to in previous build.

title: Install Patch over Base+Previous version, Logged out - Successful Log In
custom_preconds:
- Base build is installed and current store version is patched over base
- User is not logged in to an MLB.tv Account in base build.
custom_steps:
1. Install In-Test MLB.tv build
2. Launch installed build
3. Navigate to Menu>Settings
4. Activate Log in button
5. Log in to MLB.tv Account
custom_expected: App successfully allows login, next to "Logged in as" field app shows MLB.tv Account ID.

title: No Login access
custom_preconds: App has been launched with live or VOD Game Tiles displayed, user is not logged in.
custom_steps:
1. Select and activate any Game Tile
a. VOD
b. LIVE
custom_expected:
a. Only RECAP feed will be displayed; user will be able to launch video playback
AND a message will display indicating a valid login is required to view more and subscription url is required.

b. Login Required message will display
AND user can select option to Login (takes user to login screen), or dismiss (user is returned to game day view).

title: Unrecognized Login - expected messaging
custom_preconds: User is not logged in, app is on Settings page.
custom_steps:
1. Activate Log in button on Settings page.
2. Enter any text (not a valid email account!) into EMAIL and PASSWORD fields.
3. Activate [SQUARE] (Sign In)
4. Observe Messaging, activate [CIRCLE] (Try Again)
custom_expected: App shows error text "The account name or password was incorrect. Please verify login credentials and try again." at Sign In and returns to Login screen at Try Again.

title: Logout Confirmation and Logout
custom_preconds: User is logged in to any MLB.com registered account and is on Settings page
custom_steps:
1. Activate Log Out button. Log Out Confirmation Screen opens.
2. At Log Out Confirmation Screen, activate [CIRCLE] BACK
3. Activate Log Out button. Log Out Confirmation Screen opens.
4. At Log Out Confirmation Screen, activate [X] LOGOUT
custom_expected:
Confirm Log Out Confirmation screen can be closed and that Logout returns user to Settings.
Settings Log Out button should be replaced with Log In and user ID should no longer appear beneath it.

title: Login via Settings - Launch Game
custom_preconds: App is on Settings page, user is not logged in.
custom_steps:
1. Select and activate Log in
2. Login with Premium Account
3. Dismiss Account Activated message via [X] (OK)
4. Close Settings with [CIRCLE] (Back)
5. Nav to VOD game tile and activate.
6. Launch any feed.
custom_expected: Feed selected launches and playback begins

title: Login via Settings - Access Menu
custom_preconds: App is on Settings page, user is not logged in.
custom_steps:
1. Select and activate Log in
2. Login with Premium Account
3. Jump to Menu from Account Activated message via [TRIANGLE]
4. Confirm Menu appearance and dismiss via [CIRCLE] (Close)
custom_expected:
App opens Main Menu, Close returns to Settings with user's logged-in ID seen under Log out button.


this test is failing until the ticket below is fixed:
https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/MLBTVPS-79

title: Too Many Usage Attempts
custom_preconds: User is not logged in and app is at login page (via Settings or Game tile).
custom_steps:
1. At login page enter email "mlbtv+sso@gmail.com" with the password "Password1"
2. View Error message
custom_expected:
Error Message shown: "Your account is currently in use at another location.  Reset your password by logging in to MLB.com, click on 'My Profile' and change your password."


***  The expected result was a error message would be seen when user activates video playback but after MLBTVPS-153 was closed as expected this case has been adjusted: https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/MLBTVPS-153

title: Password Changed - Launch
custom_preconds:
App is linked (logged in during previous session) to an MLB.com premium entitled account and user has access to it's MLB.com account settings.
App has not been launched.
custom_steps:
1. Go to account's MLB.com settings page and change the password.
2. Launch app.
custom_expected:
Confirm user is logged out at launch. 

***Improvement planned for useful messaging to appear here.

title: Password Changed during App use - VOD Launch
custom_preconds:
App is linked (logged in during previous session) to an MLB.com premium entitled account and user has access to it's MLB.com account settings.
App has been launched and user is sitting on any Day view page with VOD games that require a premium account.
custom_steps:
1. Go to account's MLB.com settings page and change the password.
2. In app, launch any premium VOD video stream.
custom_expected: Confirm user cannot launch video, receives expected configured message and is logged out.

title: Password Changed during App use - LIVE launch
custom_preconds:
App is linked (logged in during previous session) to an MLB.com premium entitled account and user has access to it's MLB.com account settings.
App has been launched and user is sitting on any Day view page with games that require a premium account.
custom_steps:
1. Go to account's MLB.com settings page and change the password.
2. In app, launch any premium Live video stream.
custom_expected: Confirm user cannot launch video, receives expected configured message and is logged out.

title: Login: Non-Latin Characters
custom_preconds:
User's PS device set to Japanese, app launched, user not logged in to app

PS3 - got to: Settings (toolbox) > System Settings (cube icon) > System Language (2nd item in list)
custom_steps:
1. Go to Settings
2. Activate Log In
3. In Email & Password fields enter Japanese characters
4. Activate Square (Sign In)
custom_expected: Email field does not display Japanese characters and app does not freeze at Sign In button activation

title: Executive Accounts Behavior
custom_preconds:
User has access to Exec Test Account 
Live National, Regional and Locally blacked out games are available (or set up in QA with Audio included)
Live games NOT blacked out available
custom_steps:
1. Log in to Exec account via Settings
2. Nav to each type of live game in Day View and launch all feeds in Feed Select, A/V
- National
- Regional Blacked Out
- Regional not blacked out
- Locally blacked out
- Non-blacked out
- MLB PLUS Live & Archive
3. Nav to any Day View Archive game's Feed Select and launch Archive and Recap
4. Nav to Home team page
5. Launch a Highlight
6. Launch all of the game types listed above in step 2 from Home Team view (some scenarios such as MLB PLUS archive may not be available during the testing cycle and cannot be tested in QA)
custom_expected: User can log in, all feeds are accessible & launch without issue - black out is bypassed

title: Single Team Accounts
custom_preconds: User has single team account paired with Live Games options: https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/CDANDMSFT/2016+Single+Team+Test+Accounts
custom_steps:
1. Log in to single team account which has a live game playing
2. Attempt to launch all Audio feeds
3. Attempt to launch opponent feed
4. Attempt to launch single team feed
5. Repeat steps 3 & 4 with an Archive game
custom_expected: Only user's single team feed launches to video, all other games show an upsell/premium account required message

title: Free Accounts
custom_preconds:
User has access to free account and is logged in
( Create at https://securea.mlb.com/enterworkflow.do?flowId=registration.connect.wizard&c_id=mlb&template=mobile&forwardUrl=http://mlb.mlb.com/home )
App is launched to Today view
Free and Premium Live games available
custom_steps:
1. Launch Premium Live game
2. Launch free Live game
3. Launch Premium Archive game 
4. Launch free Archive game
5. Launch Recap
6. Launch MLB PLUS game 
7. Repeat above from Home Team view
8. Launch Highlight
custom_expected:
Premium games show upsell/Premium Account required message
Free games, MLB PLUS, highlights and a recap launch to playback (Pre-roll testing handled elsewhere)

title: Home/Today Navigation - Video Tile Off
custom_preconds: App is on any day's Day Grid view, 1st tile in top left is selected
custom_steps:
1. From 1st position, top left Game Tile, navigate to far right tile.
2. From top right, nav [R] 
3. Continue to navigate to each tile in the grid including attempting to select beyond Game Tile grid edges.
custom_expected: Selecting each tile shows expected highlight. Game tile grid nav does not loop top to bottom or vice-versa. [U] ARROW along top & [D] ARROW along bottom disabled if no additional rows are available, [L] along left selects 1st tile in next row down - disabled if no row available, [R] along right edge select last tile in next row up - disabled if no row available.

title: Home/Today Navigation - Video Tile On
custom_preconds: App is on any day's Day Grid view, Video tile in top left is selected but the selected state is hidden (as designed)
custom_steps:
1. From 1st position, top left Video tile, navigate to far right game tile.
2. From top right, nav [R] 
3. Continue to navigate to each tile in the grid including attempting to select beyond Game Tile grid edges.
4. Activate Video Tile.
custom_expected:
Selecting each tile shows expected highlight. Game tile grid nav does not loop top to bottom or vice-versa; right to left or vice-versa. [U] ARROW along top & [D] ARROW along bottom disabled if no additional rows are available, [L] along left and [R] along right edge disabled.

Video Tile when activated expands to full screen and [CIRCLE] Back button returns to Day View without interruption of the stream.



right navigation test currently failing due to open issue:
https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/MLBTVPS-14
SONY PS > Day View, Video Tile ON: Navigation loops Left to Right along top row

title: Today's date - Transition from 8am to TODAY
custom_preconds:
User's profile has a team set as a favorite that played a game the previous day. 
App has launched and landed on "Today" in Day View (should be yesterday's date), time is <8am PT (11am ET).
custom_steps:
1. Confirm Today's date in top right corner shows yesterday's date
2. While app is at a time preceding 8am PT (11am ET) observe Day View, confirm favorited team VOD from previous day plays in the video tile.
3. Before time reaches 8am PT (11am ET), tap [SQUARE] TODAY button.
4. Remaining on Day view, allow app to transition past 8:05am PT (11:05am ET)
5. Tap [SQUARE] TODAY button.
custom_expected:
In step 3 app does not jump from current page.
In step 5 app transitions to TODAY view for actual current date.

title: Today's date - Transition past 4pm PT (Midnight GMT)
custom_preconds: App has launched and moved to Today in Day View, time is <4pm PT (7pm ET)
custom_steps:
1. Confirm Today's date in top right corner is correct 
2. While app is at a time preceding 4pm PT (7pm ET) use the app.
3. Allow app to transition to a minimum of 4:05pm PT
4. Return to Today via SQUARE button
custom_expected: Transition past 12am GMT does not have any effect on Today view.

title: Day to Day Navigation
custom_preconds: App is in Day View, TODAY.
custom_steps:
1. Note date in top right corner.
2. Activate L1 and note the date in top right corner after transition.
3. Repeat step 2 until 10 days back have been noted.
4. Tap [SQUARE] button & confirm return to TODAY (note date in top right corner)
5. Activate R1 and note the date in top right corner after transition.
6. Repeat step 5 until 10 days forward have been noted.
7. Tap [SQUARE] button & confirm return to TODAY (note date in top right corner)
custom_expected: Today's date in steps 1, 4 and 7 should be seen in top left. Each day back or forward should show the date advance as expected.

title: All-Star Game/Break (Empty Days)
custom_steps:
1. From Main Menu activate Calendar
2. Navigate to July
3. Activate July 10th 2016
4. Activate [ R1 ] to nav to July 11th
5. Repeat step 4 until July 15th is reached
6. Activate [ L1 ] to nav to July 14th
7. Repeat step 6 until July 12th is reached
custom_expected:
- Each day tested is accessible 
- July 11, 13 & 14 show "No Games Scheduled" text
- July 12 shows All-Star Game game tile

title: Future Game Tiles: Activation
custom_preconds: User is logged in with a Premium Entitled account and app is launched and on TODAY view
custom_steps:
1. Navigate to future date via R1
2. Select any game tile and activate
custom_expected: Tile is disabled and no Error or other unwanted behavior occurs

title: Navigation
custom_preconds: Main Menu is open.
custom_steps:
1. From Home button, navigate up, right, left and down.
2. Repeat step one for each button.
custom_expected:
Left and right for every button should be disabled.
Up from top and down from bottom should be disabled.
If a button is above the button highlighted, it can be selected.
If a button is below the button highlighted, it can be selected.

title: Menu Button Activation - Home Team (first time)
custom_preconds: Time of day is after 8am PT - app has been launched, user has never used Home Team feature and Main Menu is open
custom_steps: Activate Home Team button
custom_expected: Menu closes, app jumps to Select Team to Display View

title: Menu Button Activation - Home Team (first time - back out)
custom_preconds: Time of day is after 8am PT - app has been launched, user has never used Home Team feature, is on Today view and Main Menu is open
custom_steps:
1. Activate Home Team button
- Select Team to Display View opens

2. Activate BACK
custom_expected: Select Team to Display View closes, app jumps to Today view

title: Menu Button Activation - Home Team (first time - Choose Team)
custom_preconds: Time of day is after 8am PT - app has been launched, user has never used Home Team feature, is on Today view and Main Menu is open
custom_steps:
1. Activate Home Team button
- Select Team to Display View opens

2. Select a Team and activate
custom_expected: Select Team to Display View closes, app jumps to Home Team View of Team selected in step 2

title: Menu Button Activation - Today
custom_preconds: Time of day is after 8am PT - app has been launched and Main Menu is open
custom_steps: Activate Today button
custom_expected: Menu closes, app jumps to Today Day View

title: Menu Button Activation - Calendar
custom_preconds: Time of day is after 8am PT - app has been launched and Main Menu is open
custom_steps: Activate Calendar button
custom_expected: Menu closes, app jumps to Calendar view with current month displayed

title: Menu Button Activation - Stats & Standings
custom_preconds: App has been launched and Main Menu is open
custom_steps: Activate Stats & Standings button
custom_expected: Menu closes, app jumps to Stats & Standings PU with Standings selected

title: Menu Button Activation - Settings
custom_preconds: App has been launched and Main Menu is open
custom_steps: Activate Settings button
custom_expected: Menu closes, app jumps to Settings with Show Scores toggle selected

title: Open and Close
custom_steps:
1. From Day View, activate [TRIANGLE]
2. Activate [BACK] to close.

Repeat steps 1 & 2 on the following pages.

Calendar Page
Leaderboard Page
Standings Page
custom_expected:
Main Menu opens and closes as expected:
- Main Menu returns to Today
- Calendar returns to Today
- Leaderboard & Standings return to Stats & Standings PU

title: Home Team - 'Show Scores' is checked
custom_preconds: Ensure that ‘Today’ view is selected and that ‘Show Score’ is unchecked.
custom_steps:
From ‘Today’ Menu:
1. Enter ‘Settings’ menu from ‘Today’ view
2. Under ‘Home Screen Preference’ > Check ‘Home Team’.
custom_expected: ‘Show Scores’ box is checked when selecting ‘Home Team’.

title: Home Team - Correct 'Home Team' is displayed after choosing in 'Settings' Menu
custom_preconds: Ensure that 'Home Team' view is chosen default view.
custom_steps:
1. In ‘Settings’ select a ‘home team’ under ‘home team preference’
2. Back out of the ‘settings’ menu by pressing the circle button & observe team page
3. Press [Triangle] to open Main Menu
4. Return to Settings via Settings button
5. Repeat steps 1-4 with a different team.

Complete this for all 30 teams.
custom_expected: The user is taken to the correct ‘Home Team’ each time in Step #2

title: Home Team - Ensure that 'Home Team' can be changed from 'Home Team' menu
custom_preconds: Ensure that 'Home Team' view is set to default
custom_steps:
1. Highlight and select the 'Home Team' menu located at the top of the screen.
2. Choose any team other than the one that is already selected
custom_expected:
The correct team is displayed after selecting a different 'Home Team'.

Note:
Complete this for all 30 MLB Teams.

title: Home Team - MLB Account - Ensure that 'highlights' play when not logged in with an MLB account
custom_preconds: Fresh install of the MLB app and do not login with any account.
custom_steps:
1. Make the 'Home Team' the default view.
2. From the 'Home Team' menu, select any highlight
custom_expected: The highlight plays without any issue

title: Home Team - MLB Account - Recaps and Highlights available - no other content is available when NOT logged in with an MLB account.
custom_preconds: Do not login with any MLB account type
custom_steps: 1. From the 'Home Team' view, attempt to launch either a live game or a VOD.
custom_expected:
Highlights and Recaps should launch when when not logged in with an MLB account.

No other content can be launched.

title: Home Team - 'Division Standing' - Ensure the correct 'Division Standings' is displayed
custom_preconds: Ensure that 'Home Team' is the default view
custom_steps:
1. Select a 'Home Team'
2. Observe the 'Division Standings' in the right side of the 'Home Team' view
custom_expected:
The correct standings of the selected team should be displayed.

Note:
Check for all 30 teams.
Standings: http://mlb.mlb.com/mlb/standings/

title: Home Team - 'Highlights' - Selecting 'More' takes the user to additional highlight page.
custom_preconds: Ensure that 'Home Team' is the default view
custom_steps: 1. Under the 'Highlights' section, select the 'More' button at the bottom of the highlight section
custom_expected: The user should be taken to an new page with additional highlights.

title: Home Team - 'Game Section' - Selecting 'More' takes the user to calendar view of the 'Home Team'
custom_preconds: Ensure that 'Home Team' is the default view
custom_steps: 1. Under the 'Live / VOD Game' section, select the 'More' button at the bottom of the menu.
custom_expected:
User should be taken to the 'calendar' view for the appropriate 'home team'.

Note:
Complete for all 30 MLB teams

title: Home Team - 'Game Section' - First Game tile is selected and in hover state
Calendar Grid Navigation
custom_preconds: App is on any Calendar page with the 1st selected.
custom_steps:
1. From the 1st in any month, hold the D-Pad right key down until navigation reaches last day of month confirm D-Pad right is disabled from last day
2. From the last day, hold the D-Pad left key down until navigation reaches 1st day of month and confirm D-Pad left is disabled from 1st day
3. Navigate to all buttons along top row and for each, attempt to navigate up
4. Navigate to all buttons along bottom row and for each, attempt to navigate down
custom_expected:
- All buttons are selectable, up from all buttons along top (no day buttons above) disabled, down from all bottoms along bottom (no day buttons below) disabled.
- When navigating right from right-most tile, if a row exists below, 1st tile in row below is selected. 
- When navigating left from left-most tile, if a row exists above, last tile in row above is selected. 
- D-pad hold results in multiple selections if available.

title: TODAY tag
custom_preconds: If there are no games being played in the current month, this test must be conducted in the QA environment
custom_steps:
1. From Day View, Today, open Main Menu via [TRIANGLE]
2. Activate Calendar
3. Navigate to TODAY tagged day button and activate
custom_expected: TODAY is tagged for today's actual date and activation returns to Today Day View.

title: Calendar Head
custom_preconds:
Before testing, confirm allowed/expected start and end dates

Note: Dates configured by backend - for 2016 PS3/4/Vita head is 2/25/2014
custom_steps:
1. Open Main Menu and activate Calendar
2. Activate [L1] repeatedly to navigate to previous months until reaching earliest available month
3. Activate 1st available day in month
custom_expected: App able to access expected first month and can view 1st day available (need to confirm with engineering)

title: Calendar Tail
custom_preconds:
Before testing, confirm allowed/expected start and end dates

Note: Dates configured by backend - for 2016 PS3/4/Vita Tail is  is 10/2
custom_steps:
1. Open Main Menu and activate Calendar
2. Activate [R1] repeatedly to navigate to upcoming months until reaching last available month
3. Activate last available day in month
custom_expected: App able to access expected last month and can view last day available (currently 11/2/16)

title: All-Star Game/Break Access
custom_preconds: 2016 season is in play.
custom_steps:
1. From Main Menu PU activate Calendar
2. Navigate to July
3. Activate July 11th 2016 (empty day)
4. Open Main Menu Repeat steps 1-3 but in step three activate next day in July until 12-14 have been tested
custom_expected:
- Each day tested is accessible from the Calendar
- July 11, 13 and 14 show "No Games Scheduled" text
- July 12 shows All-Star Game game tile

title: Change Display Team
custom_preconds: App has been launched with ALL TEAMS set for the Calendar view and Calendar is open to current month
custom_steps:
1. Activate [SELECT] for PS3 or [ R3 ] for PS4
2. In SELECT TEAM, choose any team (activate)
3. From Calendar activate [SELECT] for PS3 or [ R3 ] for PS4
4. In SELECT TEAM, choose any different team (activate)
5. Observe and note details of any single day in Calendar
6. Activate observed day
7. Quit app & relaunch
8. Open Main Menu > Calendar
custom_expected:
- Confirm Team Indicator in Top Left corner appears as expected, changing when choosing different teams
- Confirm confirm Calendar data reflects actual Game Day data
- Confirm Chosen Team persists after quit

title: Settings Navigation
custom_preconds: Settings has been opened from Main Menu.
custom_steps:
In Settings, navigate to all buttons and upon completion, activate [CIRCLE] Back

[CIRCLE] Back exits to Day Grid View
custom_expected:
All buttons on screen can be selected/highlighted.

Confirm the following:
- Auto-selected button at start is Show Scores
- D-pad left from all buttons on left side DA
- D-pad right from all buttons on right side DA
- D-pad up from all buttons on top edge DA
- D-pad up from all Video Tile buttons selects Show Stadium BGs
- D-pad down from Video Tile On/Off buttons on bottom edge DA
- D-pad down from Log IN/OUT button DA
- D-pad right from Video Tile Off button DA
- L/R from Show Scores <--> Home Team <--> Today can be navigated/selected
- L/R from Show Stadium BGs <--> Home Team Pref can be navigated/selected
- L/R from Video Tile On <--> Off <-->  Fave Teams can be navigated/selected

title: Default Settings
custom_preconds: Uninstall any MLB.tv app from PS3/4, turn system off, reboot system and install current build
custom_steps:
1. Launch app
2. From Today view, open Main Menu and activate Settings and observe
custom_expected:
Confirm Default Settings:

- Show Scores ON
- Show Stadium BGs ON
- Today View Video Tile PS4 ON, PS3 OFF
- Home Screen Preference TODAY
- Home Team Preference NOT set (should see default "baseball" icon)
- NO favorites set (must activate Pick Favorite Teams to confirm)
- User NOT logged in

title: Locally Retained Settings
custom_preconds: Fresh install of test build
custom_steps:
1. Launch app
2. From Today view, open Main Menu and activate Settings and adjust from default as follows:
 - Show Scores OFF
 - Show Stadium BGs OFF
 - Home Team Preference SET
 - 2 favorites set
3. Return to Team view via BACK
4. Quit app
5. Relaunch App & nav to Setting & Observe
custom_expected: Confirm new Settings are retained

title: Video Tile On/Off (Button Functionality)
custom_preconds:
- App has been launched
- User is logged in to a premium account
- Video has previously been launched 
- Video Tile ON/OFF setting is set to ON
- The Video Tile in Day View is playing video
custom_steps:
1. From Day View with Video Tile playing video, open Main Menu
2. Activate Settings and confirm Today View Video Tile is set to ON
3. Activate OFF button under Today View Video Tile 
4. Activate [CIRCLE] Back
5. Note Today View appearance and open Main Menu
6. Activate Settings  and confirm Today View Video Tile is set to OFF
7. Activate ON button under Today View Video Tile 
8. Activate [CIRCLE] Back
9. Note Today View appearance
custom_expected: Confirm the Video Tile does not appear when set to OFF and returns when set to ON and that the enabled state holds as expected.

title: Show Scores On/Off (Button Functionality)
custom_preconds: App has been launched, Show Scores is set to ON
custom_steps:
(This test is only to be used to test the Settings functionality - additional and more specific tests for Scores On/Off appear in the additional App tests)

1. From Day View with Video Tile playing video and scores on display, open Main Menu
2. Activate Settings and confirm Show Scores is set to ON
3. Toggle Show Scores to OFF (uncheck) - confirm Today View Video Tile setting automatically toggles to OFF
4. Activate [CIRCLE] Back
5. Note Today View appearance and confirm expected Scores Off appearance including Video Tile not appearing
6. Activate Settings and confirm Show Scores is set to OFF
7. Activate ON box under Today View Video Tile - confirm Show Scores setting automatically toggles to ON
8. Activate [CIRCLE] Back
9. Note Today View appearance
custom_expected:
- Confirm Scores/Game Data/Video Tile do not appear when set to OFF and return when set to ON and that the enabled states holds as expected.
- Confirm auto-toggle connectivity between Scores and Video Tile noted in steps 3 and 7

title: Favorites Tile Order
custom_preconds: Tester has launched app, is either logged in with an account that has no favorites or is logged out, has navigated to Day View & noted order of tiles.
custom_steps:
1. From Today View, open Main Menu and activate Settings
2. In Settings, choose Pick Favorite Teams
3. Choose 3 favorites and note them
4. Activate Back to Settings, Back to Day View & Observe
custom_expected:
Correct Favorites appear tagged in Today View and Grid Order Priority Rules are maintained as follows (Order displays from left to right, top to bottom):

- Live Favorite
- Upcoming Favorite
- Final Favorite
- Live
- Upcoming
- Final

title: Account to App at Login - Favorites Added
custom_preconds:
- Tester has launched app, navigated to Settings, is not logged in and no favorites have been set
- Tester has set and noted favorites in MLB.com profile (login at http://mlb.mlb.com/home  -  then visit https://secure.mlb.com/account/profile.jsp )
custom_steps:
1. In Settings, activate Log In
2. Login to profile account and close Activation Message
3. In Settings activate Pick Favorite Teams
custom_expected: Account-set favorite teams are tagged

title: Account to App at Login - Favorites Updated
custom_preconds:
- Tester has launched app, navigated to Settings, is not logged in and no favorites have been set
- Tester has set and noted favorites in MLB.com profile ( https://secure.mlb.com/account/profile.jsp )
custom_steps:
1. In Settings, choose Pick Favorite Teams
2. Choose 2 favorites that are not the same as the account-set favorite teams and note them
3. Back out to Settings and activate Login
4. Login to profile account and close Activation Message
5. Return to Pick Favorite Teams page
custom_expected: Account-set favorite teams are tagged, previous set teams are cleared

title: App to Account and Account to App Connection
custom_preconds:
- Tester has launched app, navigated to Settings, is not logged in and no favorites have been set
- Tester has confirmed no favorites have been set in MLB.com profile https://secure.mlb.com/account/profile.jsp
custom_steps:
1. In Settings activate Login
2. Login to profile account and close Activation Message
3. Activate Pick Favorite Teams 
4. Choose >2 teams and note
5. Back out to Settings and Quit App (adding this in for 2016, see Expected results note)
6. Via alt computer/device, login to same MLB.com account and check profile https://secure.mlb.com/account/profile.jsp
7. Change teams and note
8. Launch PS3/4 app and nav to Settings
9. In PS3/4 app Settings page, activate Pick Favorite Teams and observe
custom_expected:
Teams added via app appear as expected, adjustments made in account via MLB.com user profile page are relayed to app and appear as expected

(old expectation loosened, this ticket is still open and looks to be in deep freeze https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/DEVICES-2389)

title: Favorites Hidden in Team Preference Picker
custom_preconds: User has chosen >1 Favorite Team
custom_steps: In Settings, open Home Team Preference
custom_expected:
Confirm Favorite "Corner" Hints do not appear in select Team grid

Note: Design opted to leave these markers out of this view to avoid confusion.

title: Scores ON - Game Tile Views
custom_preconds: Show Scores is set to On in Settings
custom_steps:
Observe the following:

- Live Game Tile Game Status
- Today Game Tiles
- Future Game Tiles
- Past Game tiles
custom_expected: Confirm Game Tiles appear as expected on Day and Home Team views

title: Scores ON - Calendar
custom_preconds: Show Scores is set to On in Settings, Calendar has a team set for viewing
custom_steps: Observe the Calendar: current month, a future month and a past month
custom_expected: Confirm days in Calendar appear as expected

title: Scores OFF - Game Tile Views
custom_preconds: Show Scores is set to Off (unchecked) in Settings
custom_steps:
Observe the following:

- Today Game Tiles
- Future Game Tiles
- Past Game tiles
custom_expected:
Confirm Game Tiles appear as expected - only following items should appear:

- Live Game Tiles: In Progress 
- Future Game Tiles: Times and Pitchers (as seen in Scores ON)
- Past Game tiles: Final or other Status as needed

title: Scores OFF - Calendar
custom_preconds: Show Scores is set to Off (unchecked) in Settings
custom_steps: Observe the Calendar: current month, a future month and a past month
custom_expected: Confirm days in Calendar appear with only opposing team and status (time or Final/etc.)

title: Home Team - No Team Set & Back Out
custom_preconds: MLB.tv installed & no Home Team Preference set
custom_steps:
1. Launch app
2. From Today view, open Main Menu and activate Settings 
3. Select and Activate Home Team under Home Screen Preference
custom_expected: App jumps to Select Team to Display, BACK returns to Settings with Home Screen Preference set to Today

title: Home Team - No Team Set & Choose
custom_preconds: MLB.tv installed & no Home Team Preference set
custom_steps:
1. Launch app
2. From Today view, open Main Menu and activate Settings 
3. Select and Activate Home Team under Home Screen Preference 
- App jumps to Select Team to Display
4. Choose team
custom_expected: App returns to Settings with Home Team Preference set to Team set in step 4

title: Home Team - Persistence
custom_preconds: MLB.tv installed & Home Team Preference set and noted, app launched, user on Home Team view
custom_steps:
1. In Home Team, select and activate Team Chooser button
- App jumps to Select Team page 
2. Choose different team than current preference
- App jumps to chosen Team page 
3. Jump to Today view via [SQUARE] 
4. Open Main Menu and activate Home Team
custom_expected:
App jumps to Home Team page of users Home Team Preference 
_App does not jump to Team Page from step 2_

title: Home Screen - Swap Types
custom_preconds: MLB.tv installed, Home Team Preference set and Home Screen Preference set to Today (default)
custom_steps:
1. Launch app
2. From Today view, open Main Menu and activate Settings
3. In Home Team Preference select and activate Home Team
4. Activate (CIRCLE) HOME button
- App jumps to Home Team page 
5. Open Main Menu and activate Settings
6. In Home Team Preference select and activate Today
7. Activate (CIRCLE) HOME button
custom_expected: App jumps to Home Team view in step 4 and Today View in step 7

title: Launch Feed - VOD 1st time
custom_preconds: User is signed in with a valid MLB account
custom_steps:
1. Activate any archived game tile that has never been viewed before
2. Note playback start button options 
3. Activate any video feed
custom_expected:
"Beginning" is the only launch option and feed launches program from beginning.
Radio feed is not offered.

title: Launch Feed - VOD - Resume
custom_preconds: User has activated an archived Game Tile that contains a feed that the user has previously viewed for >30 seconds and playback position is known.
custom_steps:
1. Activate previously viewed archived game feed
2. Note playback start button options 
3. Activate any video feed
custom_expected: "Beginning" and "Resume" options are shown with "Resume" enabled. Launch of feed resumes from position in timeline last viewed from.

title: Launch Feed - VOD - Beginning
custom_preconds: User has activated an archived Game Tile that contains a feed that the user has previously viewed for >30 seconds and playback position is known.
custom_steps:
1. Activate previously viewed archived game feed
2. Note RESUME and BEGINNING button options 
3. Set/enable to Beginning
3. Activate any video feed
custom_expected: Feed launches from beginning.

title: Full Game Playback - VOD
custom_steps:
1. Launch any archive game.
2. Let game play through to completion.
custom_expected: App should playback full game from head to tail and exit to same view user launched from without skips/stalls or buffer issues.

title: Full Game Playback - Live
custom_steps:
1. Launch any live game in Warmup state.
2. Let game play through to completion.
custom_expected:
- App should playback full game from head to tail and exit to same view user launched from without skips/stalls/buffer issues
- Milestones should appear as expected when game is in play 

* NOTE THAT MILESTONE POSITIONING IS RARELY OFFSET AS EXPECTED - KNOWN GLOBAL ISSUE - EXPECT POSITIONS TO BE OFFSET BY UP TO 2 MINUTES

title: Launch Feed - Live Launch (1st launch)
custom_preconds: Live Game Tiles are available
custom_steps:
1. Activate a Live game tile that has yet to be viewed
2. Note playback start button options
3. Activate any video feed
custom_expected: "Beginning" and "Live" options are shown with "Live" enabled. Feed launches from Live position.

custom_steps:
1. Activate previously viewed Live game tile
2. Note radio button options
3. Activate any video feed
custom_expected: "Beginning," "Resume" and "Live" options are shown with "Live" enabled. Feed launches from Live position.

2. Note radio button options
3. Set start position Button to Beginning
3. Activate any video feed

title: Launch Feed - Live - Resume (Live Button Default)

2. Note start option buttons
3. Set Button to RESUME
4. Activate any video feed
custom_expected: "Beginning," "Resume" and "Live" options are shown with "Live" enabled. Launch of feed resumes from position in timeline last viewed from.

title: "Stay Tuned" Slate - Live
custom_steps:
1. Launch any live game in Warmup state
2. Once game play is underway (Top 1st), SEEK back to head of timeline and resume
custom_expected: Playback should start from head of broadcast, STAY TUNED slate should not appear for more than 30 seconds

title: Recap
custom_steps:
1. Launch any Recap from day view
2. Let play through to end
3. Launch another recap from Home Team view, test trickplay including SEEK to Jump, SEEK to head, Play/Pause, SEEK FWD to tail & jump
custom_expected:
- Playback is smooth, at conclusion user returned to day grid
- Trickplay functions behave as expected

title: Appearance
custom_preconds: User has successfully launched VOD playback with Show Scores Set to Off.
custom_steps: Observe UI and full appearance of all elements on screen.
custom_expected:
1. Milestones should not appear in the timeline.
2. Linescore should not be present.
3. UI Hints should not show EVENTS.
4. Innings and game time should appear as expected.

title: Trickplay FWD Scores Off
custom_preconds: User has successfully launched a VOD game stream with Show Scores set to Off and playback is behaving as expected.
custom_steps:
1. Seek FWD via D-pad single tap of right button and observe.
2. Tap D-pad [R] 4x and observe.
3. Allow seek to advance >60 mins and activate [X] to jump, then observe.
4. Tap D-pad [R] 4x and let time accumulate until it stops.
5. Activate [X] to jump.
6. Let app play video out.
custom_expected:
1 - App should show ">>" indicating speed level 1, timer should advance at associated speed.
2 - Each tap of 1-3 should increase ">" and timer should advance at associated speeds. 4th tap should be disabled and have no effect.
3 - Jump should reflect expected advance in game including increased number shown in inning indicator.
4-6 - App should jump to near end of stream and at play out, return to Day View.

title: Trickplay FWD to RWD Scores Off
custom_preconds: User has successfully launched a VOD game stream with Show Scores set to Off and playback is behaving as expected. User has skipped FWD 2+ innings via [R1] button.
custom_steps:
1. Seek FWD via D-pad single tap of right button.
2. Tap D-pad [L] 5x and observe.
3. Allow seek to advance >5 mins and activate [X] to jump, then observe.
4. Tap D-pad [L] 4x and let time accumulate until it stops.
5. Activate [X] to jump.
custom_expected:
2 - 1st tap should show indicator changing from ">>" to "<<" indicating speed level 1 RWD, timer should advance back at associated speed. Each tap 2-4 of [L] should increase "<" and timer should advance at associated speeds. 5th tap should be disabled and have no effect.
3 - Jump should reflect expected time jump back in game.
5 - App should jump to head of stream and at play video as expected.

title: Inning Skip FWD to EXIT - Scores Off
custom_preconds: User has successfully launched a VOD game stream with Show Scores set to Off and playback is behaving as expected.
custom_steps:
1. Seek FWD 40 mins and activate [X] to jump.
2. Tap R1 and note inning text advance to next expected inning.
3. Activate [X] to jump.
4. Tap L1 repeatedly until inning text reads TOP 1st.
5. Tap L1 repeatedly (nothing of note should occur).
6. Activate [X] to jump.
7. Tap R1 repeatedly beyond last inning (nothing of note should occur).
8. Activate [X] to jump and let video play out.
custom_expected: App should behave as expected, jump to expected points in game and at play out return to expected Game Day view.

title: Appearance
custom_preconds: User has successfully launched VOD playback with Show Scores Set to On.
custom_steps: Observe UI and full appearance of all elements on screen.
custom_expected:
1. Milestones should appear in the timeline and when selected, appear as expected.
2. Linescore should appear with final result populating all fields as expected.
3. UI Hints should show EVENTS and associated SONY PS button graphics.
4. Innings and total game time should appear as expected.

title: Trickplay FWD Scores On
custom_preconds: User has successfully launched a VOD game stream with Show Scores set to On and playback is behaving as expected.
custom_steps:
1. Seek FWD via D-pad single tap of right button and observe.
2. Tap D-pad [R] 4x and observe.
3. Allow seek to advance >60 mins and activate [X] to jump, then observe.
4. Tap D-pad [R] 4x and let playhead advance until it stops at the tail.
5. Activate [X] to jump.
6. Let app play video out.
custom_expected:
1 - App should show ">>" indicating speed level 1, timer should advance at associated speed.
2 - Each tap of 1-3 should increase ">" and timer should advance at associated speeds. 4th tap should be disabled and have no effect.
3 - Jump should reflect expected advance in timeline and playback should resume as expected.
4-6 - App should jump to near end of stream and at play out, return to View launched from. (eg. Home Team, or Day view)

title: Trickplay FWD to RWD Scores On
custom_preconds: User has successfully launched a VOD game stream with Show Scores set to On and playback is behaving as expected. User has skipped FWD 2+ innings via [R1] button.
custom_steps:
1. Seek FWD via D-pad single tap of right button.
2. Tap D-pad [L] 5x and observe.
3. Allow seek to advance >5 mins and activate [X] to jump, then observe.
4. Tap D-pad [L] 4x and let time accumulate until it stops.
5. Activate [X] to jump.
custom_expected:
2 - 1st tap should show indicator changing from ">>" to "<<" indicating speed level 1 RWD, timer should advance back at associated speed. Each tap 2-4 of [L] should increase "<" and timer should advance at associated speeds. 5th tap should be disabled and have no effect.
3 - Jump should reflect expected time jump back in game.
5 - App should jump to head of stream and play video as expected.

title: Audio Feeds - Live Playback
custom_preconds: App is playing back Live game video
custom_steps:
1. Activate [TRIANGLE] to access audio Menu
2. Choose alt audio and let play for 5+ minutes
3. Activate [TRIANGLE] to access audio Menu
4. Choose additional alt audio if available and let play for 5+ minutes, if not skip to step 6.
5. Activate [TRIANGLE] to access audio Menu
6. Choose original Audio feed and let play for 5+ minutes
custom_expected: Confirm audio switches as expected and plays back seamlessly without stalls/skips/failures

title: Audio Feeds - VOD/Archive Playback
custom_preconds: App is playing back VOD game video
custom_steps:
1. Activate [TRIANGLE] to access audio Menu
2. Choose alt audio and let play for 5+ minutes
3. Activate [TRIANGLE] to access audio Menu
4. Choose additional alt audio if available and let play for 5+ minutes, if not skip to step 6.
5. Activate [TRIANGLE] to access audio Menu
6. Choose original Audio feed and let play for 5+ minutes
custom_expected:
Confirm audio switches as expected and plays back seamlessly without stalls/skips/failures  
  
A fail still exists on the PS3: PS3 Only > Sometimes you are unable to select an audio feed during a live game. - https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/MLBTVPS-263

title: Box Score - Live Playback
custom_preconds:
App is playing back Live game video. User has access to current stats of game being watched.

***NOTE: Case currently fails due to bug https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/MLBTVPS-151, which as of 6/27/2016 remains Open and in Blocked status
custom_steps:
1. During playback, open Box Score via [SQUARE] and note team opened, compare to team at bat.
2. Cycle through all pages, both teams, confirm accuracy of current Box Score
3. Leaving Box Score open, confirm statistic update as expected.
custom_expected:
Box Score should open to current team at bat, stats should be accurate and update in real time.

***Known issue: Box Score in Live playback does not update in real time after opening, but updates when closing and reopening

title: Box Score - VOD Playback
custom_preconds: App is playing back Archive game video. User has access to final stats of game being watched.
custom_steps:
1. During playback, open Box Score via [SQUARE] and cycle through all pages, both teams
2. Confirm accuracy of current Box Score
custom_expected:
Box Score is correct and matching end of game total

***Known issue: Improvement logged, ideally app will update based on position in the timeline.

title: Captions Live/VOD Appearance
custom_preconds: User is logged in to a Premium Account, Live games are available for playback
custom_steps:
1. Launch a live game
2. Tap R3 to activate Captions and observe
3. After 2+ minutes of playback, tap R3 to close captions.
4. Exit video and launch VOD game, repeat steps 1-3.
custom_expected:
Confirm captions appear as expected in both Live and VOD playback.

***Known Issues: 
-Ideally user's MLB.com account profile settings for captions would be respected but currently are not.
-App does not respect user's last activation state, captions reset to off at playback end.

title: Appearance
custom_preconds: User has successfully launched Live playback with Show Scores Set to Off.
custom_steps: Observe UI and full appearance of all elements on screen.
custom_expected:
- Milestones should not appear in the timeline.
- Linescore should not be present.
- UI Hints should not show EVENTS.
- Innings should appear only if navigated to as described in WF documentation.
- Game time should be hidden

Known open issue is in backlog for fixes causes this to fail:
https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/MLBTVPS-231
Live games will display milestones as well as inning info, when only Inning info should display.

6 - Playback should jump to Live position

title: Launch Audio Feed - Confirm Appearance
custom_preconds: Feed Select for a live game is open and at least one Audio Feed is available.
custom_steps: Activate any Audio Feed.
custom_expected:
Confirm feed launches as expected, expected audio plays, Game Data/Innings appear current and as expected and background matching game's current venue is shown.

***Game running time is shown but only shows time counting up from user launch, may be removed in the future rather than fixed.

title: Feed Playback
custom_preconds: Audio feed has been successfully launched and is playing back expected audio.
custom_steps: Confirm audio plays through from near beginning to completion.
custom_expected: Audio plays back as expected and jumps out to view launched from upon completion.

title: Live Updates - Line Score & Box Score
custom_preconds: Audio feed has been successfully launched and is playing back expected audio.
custom_steps:
1. Open Box Score via [SQUARE] button.
2. Cycle through and observe all stats, compare to live stats via web.
3. Close Box Score. 
4. Let game play for >10 minutes (a score change or inning change must occur in order to complete test in step 5).
5. During this time, observe Line Score
6. Open Box Score via [SQUARE] button.
7. Cycle through and observe all stats, compare to live stats via web.
custom_expected:
1st look (step 2): All expected Box Score Pages are available and match when compared to expected actual stats
Line Score check in step 5 shows data updates
2nd look (step 6): All expected Box Score Pages are available and match when compared to expected actual stats

title: Pause/Play and Exit
custom_preconds: Audio feed has been successfully launched and is playing back expected audio.
custom_steps:
1. During playback, activate [X] to "pause"
2. Activate [X] to resume.
3. Tap [CIRCLE] to exit.
custom_expected:
Confirm playback stops at pause (does not pause and hold position in stream - this is OK and as expected), resumes from live position at resume and exits Audio Player to page launched from at [CIRCLE] activation.

***Known issue: 
Text reads Pause but functionality is more accurately a STOP. Resume picks up from LIVE. Ticket exploring adjusting the presentation of this feature has been logged.

title: Archived game > in game browser > Live game

Select any game already in progress and then select a Video Feed

The game window shrinks and a list of games appears and is navigable and selectable
The selected game launches a feed select
A selected feed launches the game in progress - both Audio and Video

Note: the game picker option (L3) is not available when viewing the Audio feed

Select any Video Feed already in progress (LIVE GAME)

Repeat test above but launch an Audio Feed.

The game window shrinks and a list of games appears and is navigable and selectable
The selected game launches a feed select
A selected feed launches the game in progress (test both Video feeds and Audio feeds)
No errors are observed

title: Spring Training Vs. Regular Season [MARK BLOCKED UNTIL REWRITTEN]
custom_preconds: Tester must be able to change and implement the loading config file's (lithium_ps3/lithium_ps4) "fakedate" value to dates falling inside and outside the Spring Training date range.
custom_steps:
1. With the fakedate value set to <4/5/15 open Main Menu via [TRIANGLE]
2. Activate Stats & Standings
3. Activate Leaderboards and note Leaderboard View
4. Toggle to alt View via [X] and note result
5. Repeat complete test with step #1 fakedate value set to >4/5/15
custom_expected:
Date before 4/5/15 opens to Spring Training Leaderboards, user can toggle to Regular Season 2014 stats
Date on or after 4/5/15 opens to 2015 Leaderboards, user can toggle to Spring Training Leaderboards

title: Leaderboard Navigation
custom_preconds: User has navigated to Leaderboards via Stats & Standings PU and tester has noted R1/L1 upcoming page hints
custom_steps:
1. Note R1 adjacent next page hints
2. Tap [R1 ] to nav right
2. Confirm enabled page indicator shifts right
3. Confirm Page title changes to expected
4. Confirm previous page hint appears as expected
5. Repeat steps 1-4 until all pages have been seen
6. Note L1 adjacent previous page hints
7. Tap [L1] to nav left
8. Confirm enabled page indicator shifts to previous
9. Confirm Page title changes to expected
10. Confirm next page hint appears as expected
11. Repeat steps 6-10 until all pages have been seen
12. Activate [SQUARE] to shift to AL and repeat steps 1-11
13. Activate [SQUARE] to shift to NL and repeat steps 1-11
14. Activate [SQUARE] to return to MLB
15. Activate [CIRCLE] Back
custom_expected:
- Confirm all pages are navigable and appear as expected
- [CIRCLE] Back exits to Stats & Standings PU Menu

title: Stat Confirmation
custom_preconds:
User has access to current MLB statistics.

Note: 
depending on time of year the submission is taking place -  the stats featured in app will appropriately be updated to reflect the current interests of fans (externally configurable).

Releases-
Spring Training  (before or mid-March): Spring Training and/or Reg Season Stats pages will display
Opening Day (mid-March - April 1st): Spring Training and/or Reg Season Stats pages will display
All-Star Game (early July): Regular Season and Wild Card
Post-Season (September-ish): ? TBD - not sure if any additional stats are available in app
custom_steps: Spot check a minimum of 5 Leaderboards in each view (ST vs. 2015)
custom_expected: Confirm Leaderboard displays statistics accurately

title: Toggle Regular Season to WC/ST
custom_preconds: User must determine if  app config is set to Wild Card or Spring Training
custom_steps:
1. Activate Stats & Standings
2. Activate Standings and note Standings View
3. Toggle to alt View via [X] and note result
4. Toggle back to previous state
custom_expected: App should allow accurate toggle between Regular Season and the alt view (WC or ST)

title: Standings Navigation
custom_steps:
1. From Main Menu, activate Stats & Standings
2. Activate Standings
3. Toggle to alt view via [SQUARE] and confirm alt view appears
4. Toggle to initial view via [SQUARE] and confirm initial view appears
5. Again toggle to alt view via [SQUARE] and confirm alt view appears
6. From alt view, activate [CIRCLE] Back
7. Activate Standings
8. From Initial view, activate [CIRCLE] Back
custom_expected:
Confirm all nav behaves as expected:

- [CIRCLE] Back always returns to Stats & Standings PU
- [SQUARE] Toggle toggles to expected view

title: Network Error (LAN pull during Video Playback)
custom_preconds: App is launched
custom_steps:
1. Open any Feed Select and launch any video
2. Pull LAN from device or wall
custom_expected:
Network Error Message seen - "Network Error - Cannot connect to MLB.TV. Please check your network connection and try again."
Return of LAN allows recovery - user returned to either the 'Today' or 'Home Team' views, dependent on where the feed was launched.

title: Network Error (LAN pull during App Nav)
custom_preconds: App is launched
custom_steps: 1. Pull LAN from wall or device
custom_expected:
PS3: 
User is logged out of PSN, Network Error Messaging seen in the Background
Return of LAN allows recovery

PS4: 
Network Error Message seen - "Network Error - Cannot connect to MLB.TV. Please check your network connection and try again."
Return of LAN allows recovery

title: Maintenance Mode
custom_preconds: Tester must contact dev and request the various Maintenance Modes noted below
custom_steps:
1. With app not launched, request Maintenance Mode to be triggered with maintenanceModeOnly = true
2. Allow >3 minutes for config to update
3. When confirmed, launch app and observe.
4. Quit app.
5. With app not launched, request Maintenance Mode to be triggered with maintenanceModeOnly = false
6. Allow >3 minutes for config to update
7. When confirmed, launch app and observe.
custom_expected:
- Tester should observe expected (configurable) message - currently "MLB.TV is currently undergoing maintenance. Please try again later."
- When maintenanceModeOnly = true, user must quit to dismiss.
- When maintenanceModeOnly = false, user can dismiss and application loads

Note: Work with dev, if the test fails sometimes they need to clear a cache. Only fail if you are unable to trigger the expected results after working with dev.

title: Blackout - Local
custom_preconds:
- QA environment features local Blackout game (in SF that's any LA game due to IP oddities, in NY any NY game) with live video attached
- User is logged in to QA-facing app with entitled account
custom_steps: Open game tile for local game with live video attached
custom_expected: Feed select shows expected blackout messaging - check current message QA config for specific device to confirm correct/expected text

- User is logged in to QA-facing app with entitled account
custom_steps: Open game tile for Regional game with live video attached
custom_expected: Feed select shows expected blackout messaging - check current message QA config for specific device to confirm correct/expected text

title: Fake Dates - Beyond Season
custom_preconds: Tester must be able to change and implement the loading config file's (lithium_ps3/lithium_ps4) "fakedate" value to dates specified.
custom_steps:
Launch app in the following configuration:

- Sony PS System Date set beyond 11/4/2015  +  App fakedate set to 11/4/2015 (last day of Postseason)

Check Calendar & Day View nav and season limits. Make sure to access Calendar and Today via Main Menu.
custom_expected: Confirm app does not crash or otherwise display errant behavior.

title: Candy Bar Remote Tests
custom_preconds: Tester must have a PS Bluetooth Remote paired with the associated PS system
custom_steps: (Complete steps to come)
custom_expected:
Confirm mapping to PS Remote allows user to control app as expected

- Note: Stop is not mapped by design - may be in future 

KNOWN ISSUE - This is an auto-fail for PS4 until this is addressed by Sony or our team, R3 (captions) and L3 (game picker) options not available in Video Playback as they are missing from the remote: https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/MLBTVPS-238

title: Remote Play Enabled (Required)
custom_steps:
1. On Home/XMB Menu screen, highlight app icon
2. Activate Triangle
3. Activate *Check function
custom_expected:
Check for the appropriate messaging

- PS3 “[Info]	PS Vita/PSP™ remote play is supported. (PS Vita: 480p (852x480), PSP™: AVC (480x272))”
- PS4  “param.sfo: Param REMOTE_PLAY_KEY_ASSIGN = 0x1 (Pattern B)”.
- PS4 if recently added only “param.sfo: Param REMOTE_PLAY_KEY_ASSIGN: Added by the Patch”

title: In-App Network "FAQ" Message Check
custom_preconds:
PS4 - Special Build required with lithium_ps4 config value set to simulateStall=true (allows cheat PS4 touchpad tapped 5 times will activate messaging)
PS3 - Throttle network, must see buffer spinner 5 times within 60 seconds to activate the messaging
custom_steps:
1. Play any Video Stream (live or archive)
2. Tap associated button 5 times to activate cheat.
3. Advance through initial Pop Up and through two text pages while observing text.
custom_expected: No typos, formatting errors or misuse of Sony terminology should be seen.
